waves.text: I woke up to silence today, broken only by the distant groans of the undead.
This fortress I built with my hands might be my only salvation. First entry: Survive.
The morning brought a grim realization: my supplies are dwindling.
I scavenged through nearby buildings, dodging the ever-lurking undead.
I found an old photograph of my family today. Their faces are blurry now.
The horde grows thicker outside. I miss them more than I thought possible.
A stranger appeared at the gates, begging for shelter. I couldn’t take the risk.
Turning him away broke something inside me. Is humanity more fragile than I imagined?
The undead tried to breach the walls today. My ammunition is running low.
I’ve started rationing my bullets, aiming for the head. Every wasted shot is a risk.
There’s a pattern to their behavior—almost as if they’re being guided.
A memory surfaced: rumors of experiments, a virus gone wrong. Is this man-made?
Today, I’ll write my final entry. My plan is set—fortify the walls, secure ammo.
This is not the end. If someone finds this, know I fought to the very last moment.
